newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico grants Conagas natgas distribution rights.
newsitem.headline: Mexico grants Conagas natgas distribution rights.

text.p: Mexico's Energy Regulatory Commission (CRE) said on Tuesday it granted natural gas distribution rights to Compania Nacional de Gas (Conagas) for the region surrounding Piedras Negras, Coahuila state.
Because the company has supplied the fuel to the region since 1935, regulations allowed the contract to be granted without holding a public auction, the CRE said.
Two other distribution rights have been auctioned off to international consortia in the first of a series of privatizations to encourage use of the fuel in Mexico.
"To determine its distribution rates, the Commission authorized Conagas to use an initial average rate of 62.92 pesos per gigacalorie," the CRE said.

Under the terms of its contract, the company commits to serving at least 25,608 customers after five years, with an investment of more than 5.2 million pesos. Conagas has a 125 mile (200 km) pipeline network and supplies 15,000 customers per day, of which 96 percent are residential users, the CRE said.

The Piedras Niegras region borders Eagle Pass, Texas, and is located about 130 miles (240 kilometers) west of San Antonio, Texas. The region counts with a growing population of 115,000 residents, which could increase to 224,095 people by 2012, according to latest census reports.
